content: 3 pick up 16 stitches you can make squares separately following along the top left-hand edge of diamond 1 the instructions above and sew them place marker then cast on 16 stitches using the together backwards loop cast on method alternatively use the join-as-you-go method for diamonds that are not on the edges like this is my personal preference diamond 4 pick up 16 stitches from the side of the diamond on the right 2 place marker pick rotate your first square so it is a diamond up centre stitch from the tip of the diamond with the top point being where you finished below then pick up 15 stitches on the side of knitting and fastened off then you knit a the diamond to the left 3 square actually a diamond to the right-hand side for the first one then to the left-hand note that when you join squares this way the side and then knit a diamond between those first row you actually knit is row 2 ws the cast 2 new diamonds on/pick up pick up/cast on and pick up row are row 1 4 finishing it s recommended that you weave in your ends every couple of squares if you are making a blanket perhaps consider adding a knitted or crocheted edge starter kit you can purchase a starter
